td.content: s:50 year old white female presents with mild shortness of breath, severe dyspnea, critical posterior thoracic pain on respiration and Cancer for 7 days. she has a history of Lung Cancer for past 2 years. Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol she smokes one pack daily for 2 years o:Height 60 in, Weight 97 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 16, PET Scan Lung shows a large focal hypermetabolic area on the right consistent with a 4.5 x4.2x 3.5 cm mass in the central portion of the right upper lobe, multiple other smaller hypermetabolic areas suggest lymph node metastatic disease in the chest, abdomen, and right supraclavicular region a:Lung Cancer p:administered cisplatin - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, irinotecan - 60 mg/m2 3 times per month, performed PET Scan Lung, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
